Using Non-Exclusive Locks in Integrations

The personal option named Use Non-Exclusive Locks In Integrations affects how files are locked when accessed from application integrations, such as those with Visual Studio .NET and PowerBuilder. If you select this check box, locking a file (for example, as part of a Check Out operation) creates a non-exclusive lock rather than an exclusive lock.

To use non-exclusive locks with integrations:

  1. Select Tools > Personal Options from the menu bar. The Personal Options dialog opens.

  2. Select the Files tab.

  3. Select the Use Non-exclusive locks in integrations check box.

  4. Click OK.

Note: When you are using an application integration for a development environment, you cannot check in files from that environment if both the Require exclusive lock when files are checked in check box on the Project Properties dialog (Options tab) and the Use non-exclusive locks in integrations check box on the Personal Options dialog (File tab) are selected. In this situation, clear the check box for Use non-exclusive locks in integrations to check files in.
